Calcutta High Court (Appellete Side)

Indian Penal Code. (G.R. Case No.2483 Of ... vs In Re: Shambhu Bouri on 13 December, 2024

 13.12.2024
 Sl. No.35
 akd
 [ALLOWED]
 C. R. M. (A) 4385 of 2024

 In Re: An application for anticipatory bail under Section 482 of the
 Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023 filed on 03.12.2024 in
 connection with Salanpur Police Station Case No.137 of 2023 dated
 01.09.2023 under 
Sections 498A
/
323
/
325
/
354B
/
307
/
506
/
34
 of the
 Indian Penal Code. (G.R. Case No.2483 of 2023)

 And

 In Re: Shambhu Bouri
 ... ... Petitioner
 Mr. Abhishek Halder
 Ms. Madhurima Basu
 Mr. Debabrata Halder
 ... ... for the petitioner

 Md. Adil Badr
 Mr. Sandip Kundu
 ... ... for the State

 1.
 It is submitted on behalf of the petitioner that he is the husband

 of the victim lady. It is further submitted petitioner and other in-laws

 were falsely implicated over a matrimonial discord. Co-accused has

 been granted pre-arrest bail. Accordingly, he prays for the same relief.

 2. Learned Advocate for the State opposes the prayer for

 anticipatory bail and submits victim suffered injuries.

 3. We have considered the materials on record including the

 statement of the victim and injury report. It is alleged one Robin Bouri

 i.e. brother-in-law outraged the modesty of the victim. The said co-

 accused has been granted pre-arrest bail. Allegation against the

 petitioner-husband is with regard to assault. However, injuries are

 simple. In view of the aforesaid facts, we are of the opinion custodial

 interrogation of the accused/petitioner is not necessary and he may be

 granted anticipatory bail.

 4. Accordingly, we direct in the event of arrest, the

 accused/petitioner, namely, Shambhu Bouri, be released on bail upon
Signed By : ARUP
KUMAR DAS
High Court of
Calcutta
16 th of
December 2024
04:55:22 PM

 2

 furnishing a bond of Rs.10,000/- (Rupees Ten thousand only), with two

 sureties of like amount each, to the satisfaction of the arresting officer

 and also subject to the conditions as laid down under 
Section 482(2)
 of

 the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023 and on further condition

 that the petitioner shall appear before the jurisdictional court and pray

 for regular bail within four weeks from date.

 5. The application for anticipatory bail is, thus, disposed of.

 (Apurba Sinha Ray, J.) (Joymalya Bagchi, J.)

Signed By : ARUP
KUMAR DAS
High Court of
Calcutta
16 th of
December 2024
04:55:22 PM

1.

2. Learned Advocate for the State opposes the prayer for
anticipatory bail and submits victim suffered injuries.
3. We have considered the materials on record including the
statement of the victim and injury report. It is alleged one Robin Bouri
i.e. brother-in-law outraged the modesty of the victim. The said co-

petitioner-husband is with regard to assault. However, injuries are
simple. In view of the aforesaid facts, we are of the opinion custodial
interrogation of the accused/petitioner is not necessary and he may be
granted anticipatory bail.
4. Accordingly, we direct in the event of arrest, the

accused/petitioner, namely, Shambhu Bouri, be released on bail upon

furnishing a bond of Rs.10,000/- (Rupees Ten thousand only), with two
sureties of like amount each, to the satisfaction of the arresting officer

that the petitioner shall appear before the jurisdictional court and pray
for regular bail within four weeks from date.
5. The application for anticipatory bail is, thus, disposed of.

suggested_precedents.full_citation: Arnesh Kumar v. State of Bihar, (2014) 8 SCC 273
suggested_precedents.legal_principle: Mandatory arrest not required for offences punishable less than 7 years
